title: 115_s592
content: The Act titled "Department of Defense Cyber Scholarship Program Act of 2017" aims to reinvigorate and modify the Information Assurance Scholarship Program. The Act aims to address the growing cyber threats to US interests by emphasizing the importance of a well-trained cyber workforce, as highlighted in the Department of Defense Cyber Strategy. The Department of Defense Cyber Strategy emphasizes the importance of improving civilian recruitment and retention for fulfilling cyber missions. Community colleges offer degrees in cybersecurity to prepare students for high-demand jobs. The Information Assurance Scholarship Program promotes recruitment, education, and retention of cybersecurity professionals since 2001. The Department of Defense Cyber Strategy highlights the need to enhance civilian recruitment and retention for cyber missions. The Information Assurance Scholarship Program, crucial for cybersecurity efforts, has faced budget cuts since 2013. Congress suggests reinvigorating the program and supporting cybersecurity degree programs at US educational institutions. The program is a critical cybersecurity effort led by the Chief Information Officer of the Department of Defense. It aims to support cybersecurity programs at 2-year higher education institutions, recruit and retain scholarship recipients, and build capacity at these institutions. The Information Assurance Scholarship Program is being modified to provide financial assistance for civilian recruitment and retention in cyber missions. The Department of Defense Cyber Scholarship Program provides financial assistance and grants for cybersecurity programs at 2-year higher education institutions. A minimum of five percent of funding is allocated for associate degree pursuit. $10,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 2018. The Secretary of Defense must submit a plan to revitalize the Department of Defense Cyber Scholarship Program by September 30, 2018, to the congressional defense committees. $10,000,000 is allocated for fiscal year 2018.
